posts.name: Paul Regnier
posts.cooked: With the Kraken adapter for the drive motor, would this theoretically let you run CTRE swerve gen Maxswerve?
Theoretically yes if you use the Talon FXS for the Minion, however, I am unsure if the x60 would fit with such a tight gap between the Minion and Vortex.

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked:
So, is there an adapter between the SplineXS on the Minion and the 13 tooth pinion input for the Ultraplanetary slice?  Or what is this setup?

No, we haven’t smoked any NEO 550s on the MaxSwerve in the 3 years running them.  Also, they ran pretty well all year with minimal changes to the swerve template.

I would think the Kraken should fit where the Vortex but don’t know for certain.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked:
The damage there is caused by pre-existing damage (a broken feedback wire) rather than burning up due to a typical swerve load.

I also haven’t seen a 550 fail in swerve either.

posts.name: Max Morehead
posts.cooked:
I don’t know exactly how you were thinking to manufacture that, especially if it’s one part.

If solid SplineXS stock was a thing and you had a lathe, you could turn the end of a length to 0.125" and press a UP 550 pinion on. Then use a gear or the SplineXS hex adapter ( WCP -1118) as a “coupler”.

You could turn the end of some threaded rod to 0.125", press the pinion on, and thread/green loctite it into the end of the minion shaft (I don’t know if it’s a good idea to rely on the threaded connection for torque transmission, I’d guess probably not).

@beedward 's idea is probably the best. Solving this is the main difficulty of adapting the minion/kraken x44 for MaxSwerve.

Mark_Wasserman:

Actually, I am that desperate.

Hope that doesn’t mean 2767 is ditching the 3rd coast drive.

posts.name: Mark Wasserman
posts.cooked:
Max_Morehead:

Hope that doesn’t mean 2767 is ditching the 3rd coast drive.

Nope, just strategically diversifying.  We figured out how to adapt a Minion to a versaplanetary using only a 3D printer so now its time to tackle the ultra.

posts.name: Max Morehead
posts.cooked:
Max_Morehead:

If solid SplineXS stock was a thing

This is now a thing, since the center of these thrifty bot shafts appear to be solid, so I would think this would be the cleanest way to adapt SplineXS for UP if you have a lathe.

Steel SplineXS shafts. Primarily used with the Thrifty Cycloidal gearbox. Stub shafts include 10-32 threaded holes for a 3/8" long bolt.

Price: USD 9.99
